meanings.definition: To bring up and care for (a child) until they are fully grown.
meanings.sent1: She reared her little sister with love and patience.
meanings.sent2: The parents reared their children in a nurturing environment.
meanings.sent3: The babysitter reared the kids like a responsible adult.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the protagonist reared the orphaned child as her own.
meanings.sent5: He reared his nephew into a fine young man.

meanings.sent1: The farmer reared chickens for their eggs.
meanings.sent2: They reared cattle on the vast ranch.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper reared the pandas with care and attention.
meanings.sent4: The shepherd reared his flock of sheep in the green meadows.
meanings.sent5: She reared a litter of puppies with great affection.

meanings.sent1: The workers reared a new building in the city center.
meanings.sent2: They reared a sturdy fence around the property.
meanings.sent3: The team reared a makeshift shelter in the wilderness.
meanings.sent4: The villagers reared a monument to honor their ancestors.
meanings.sent5: He reared a beautiful house on the hilltop.

meanings.definition: To rise up on the hind legs, as a horse.
meanings.sent1: The horse reared in fright at the sudden noise.
meanings.sent2: The stallion reared gracefully during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The pony reared playfully in the meadow.
meanings.sent4: The mare reared proudly in the show ring.
meanings.sent5: He reared his steed to show its strength.
